results.description:
Overview

In 1994, Konami developed the first Taisen Puzzle-Dama for the Arcade. They followed it up for multiple sequels for home systems, many of which feature characters of a specific anime license or a Konami property.

The general goal is to stack blocks of the same color and having them vanish when three of the same type are touching. Removing blocks also frees "trapped" blocks which in turn will vanish in groups in three. The idea is to set up huge chains by freeing these trapped blocks in groups of three or larger, dropping a lot of "trash" trapped blocks on the opponent. The opponent is capable of sending these back, however, leading to a lot of back-and-forth.
results.name: Taisen Puzzle-Dama

results.description:
Overview

Arthur is a series of books, television shows, and video games starring Arthur Read. The franchise started as a series of children's books created by Marc Brown. The series then got turned into a children's cartoon on PBS.

The games in the Arthur franchise are geared towards younger children and are usually educational.
results.name: Arthur

results.description:
Overview

Aretha is a fantasy RPG series from JAM (Japan Art Media) and Yanoman. The series began as a trio of Game Boy RPGs: Aretha, Aretha II and Aretha III. The year after the last Aretha a new canon began on the Super Famicom which featured the wizard Ariel. The Ariel games included 1993's Aretha: The Super Famicom and 1994's Aretha II: Ariel no Fushigi na Tabi. A spin-off/gaiden SFC game named Rejoice: Aretha Oukoku no Kanata was released in 1995 and is presently the final game in the series.
results.name: Aretha

results.description: Clearly inspired by The Legend of Zelda, the game changed perspective throughout the three games. The first RoboMaze is a top down action adventure, the second game a sidescroller and the third returns to the top down view.
results.name: Robo Maze

results.description:
Overview

Lost Lands is a series of hidden object games that use a fantasy theme. The series is developed by FIVE-BN Games.
results.name: Lost Lands

results.description:
Overview

The Mad Max series consists of games based on the Mad Max film franchise.
results.name: Mad Max

results.description:
Overview

The Mythic Wonders franchise is a series of hidden object adventure games developed by Organic 2 Digital. All the games in the series has some sort of fantasy or paranormal theme to them.
results.name: Mythic Wonders

results.description:
Overview

The Assault Ops franchise is a series of modern military themed shooters. The games were developed by indie developer Rendercode Games. The games range from top-down third person shooting to first-person shooting.
results.name: Assault Ops

results.description:
Overview

The Zombie Defense Squad franchise is a series of first-person wave based shooters. The series is developed by Strange Games Studios. The first two games were originally released on Xbox Live Indie Games.
results.name: Zombie Defense Squad
Decisive Battles of World War II
Decisive Battles of World War II

results.description:
Overview

Developed by Fireproof Games, the first game entitled The Room was released in September 2012 for iPhone, with an Android version coming the following March. The Room presents players with a series of strange puzzle boxes typically hiding a number of mechanisms within it. The goal is for players to, by manipulating the box through touch and rotation, access all the mechanisms, thereby unlocking further mechanisms in the box and ultimately solving the box itself. Each mechanism is typically some sort of lock solved by spinning the box, turning keys, opening hatches, flipping switches, and other activities performed on the touch screen.

The Room Two was released for iPad on December 12, 2013 with iPhone and Android versions following shortly after. The Room Two features more complex puzzles consisting of a room containing multiple puzzle boxes as opposed to the original's single box puzzles.

The Room Three was released for mobile devices in November 2015.
results.name: The Room

results.description: AdventureQuest is a free-to-play browser-based RPG. With a deep and rich lore, AdventureQuest continues to grow through weekly updates of content, giving players a vast storyline to explore. Weekly updates consist of new quests, events, items, and/or areas. The game is free-to-play, however, there is a one-time purchase that can be made to upgrade Adventurer characters to Guardians. This was set up to help the game’s ongoing development and grants players full access to the game and any guardian only quests along with added perks.
results.name: AdventureQuest
